intro: Gagea fistulosa var. dyris, commonly known as the Dyris gagea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open woodlands and mountainous regions. It is known for its delicate appearance and early spring blooming habit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
